name: Staybridge Suites Louisville East

reviews.text: I stayed here as part of a road trip based on Tripadvisor reviews.
reviews.title: Good Staybridge

reviews.text: I used award points to stay, so was given a studio suite.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel!!! The staff really makes the place.

reviews.text: The room was standard Staybridge Suites, same furniture and finishes as all the other Staybridges I have been to. The bed was fine, and the pillows were the usual Staybridge--not great and not terrible. There was a refrigerator and cooktop, and kitchen utensils, all clean and new-appearing.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable Stay

reviews.text: This location seems to be aggressive about keeping the hotel up to date. The TV was flat screen, and visible from all parts of the room. The carpet and upholstery looked as if it had just been replaced. I noticed other ongoing improvements in the public areas. Everything inside the hotel was clean.
reviews.title: Best motel I ever stayed in! You can't beat this.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Clean Spacious Rooms, Great Location, Nice Staff!!

reviews.text: I was very pleased with our stay at Staybridge Suites outside Louisville. Although it is located just off the expressway with other motels, a megachurch and a gas station, inside this hotel reminded me very much of the higher end hotels I stay at when I travel for business. Out 1 bedroom suite had a king-size bed with nice linens and tons of pillows, and the pull-out couch in the living room was fairly comfortable and came with a sealed package of linens to make it up with. There was a flat screen TV with channel guide, a full kitchen with fridge, dishwasher, microwave, toaster, toaster oven and 2-burner stovetop. Dishes, towels, pot holders and cookware were clean and new-looking.
reviews.title: Many of the amenities of a high-end hotel

reviews.text: The pool area was immaculate and stocked with decent-sized towels and the continental breakfast was miles better than those offered at most road-side hotels. There were various juices, 4 cold cereals, hot Quaker oatmeal with toppings, eggs, biscuits with gravy, name-brand gourmet coffee, bagels, breads and danishes. All served on Fiestaware--although disposable dishes were available for those who wished to take their food up to their rooms.
reviews.title: Another good Staybridge - easy access to everywhere
Great Experience
reviews.text: The front desk staff was helpful and efficient and there were 2 luggage carts to make bringing suitcases from the parking lot up the elevator into the rooms convenient.

This is a standard Staybridge Suites property, which is to say it is largely outstanding and all the previous reviews are spot on. Picked this property because I was attending a convention in downtown Louisville, but needed to be on the outskirts for other reasons.
reviews.title: Great hotel that pleased even the pickiest of wives!!!

reviews.text: It's about 15 mins to downtown, and even during morning rush it was no problem driving there as traffic was not bad at all. It's also on the eastern edge of Louisville, so if you need to get to Frankfort the capital or Lexington it's a good choice. Also the hotel is very close to I-64, but is very quiet and you don't hear any highway noise. There's a Harley Davidson shop across the parking lot. Not a lot of restaurants around, but you can find some great choices in 10-15 mins drive.
reviews.title: another great staybridge property...home on the road!...

reviews.text: I'll cut right to the point.
reviews.title: Good breakfast, Friendly Staff, Maids need to be re-trained

likes.disliked: — The ability of the maids to clean our room.

reviews.text: My friend and I flew into Louisville for the 135th Kentucky Derby. While the hotel is not downtown, it was well within the price range for our stay. Access to the highway was literally down the street, so travel was not much of an inconvenience. Free parking at the hotel was also a huge plus. The hotel staff were extremely courteous, pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Outstanding Value - All of the Amenities, Clean and Comfortable
Much better than the other area options
reviews.text: Upon check-in, we were greeted with Mrs. Fields cookies and chocolates, as well as a complimentary 2009 Kentucky Derby scrap book which was so nice, we had to ask to make sure it was free!

We were pleasantly surprised by our room - advertised as One King Bed with Pull-Out Sofa. It was extremely spacious with the bedroom completely separate from the living area. We loved the "synthetic down" pillows on the bed (there were 6 pillows on our king bed with 2 more in the closet). There were plenty of electrical outlets in both the bedroom area and living area for laptops, cameras and cell phone chargers. Complimentary wi-fi access was not quite as fast as the high speed broadband I have at home, but it was definitely much faster than a DSL connection.
reviews.title: Loved this place.....perfect for family of three!

likes.liked: — Thie size of the rooms, and bathrooms

reviews.text: The kitchen had a full-sized fridge, a dishwasher, sink, and small electric stove. An added bonus was the ice maker in the freezer - no running down the hallway in the middle of the night with a plastic ice bucket to the noisy communal ice machine, and no inconvenience of "make your own" ice trays. Real china in the cupboards and the silverware even included steak knives and a bottle/can opener.
reviews.title: Very Impressed with this Hotel.

reviews.text: The iron and full-sized ironing board came in quite handy and there were more than enough hangers and storage racks in the closet for the both of us during our stay. We also had an abundance of fresh towels (I usually end up having to ask for extras and this time I did not) and I enjoyed the toiletries in the Ginseng and Mint fragrance. The shower had the best water pressure I've enjoyed at a hotel.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

aka: Staybridge Suites Louisville East Hotel Louisville
description: Welcome to your home away from home in the Derby City area, the Staybridge Suites® Louisville – East extended stay hotel. Whether it's business or leisure that brings you to Louisville, Kentucky, the hotel's consummate staff is poised to help you take advantage of all that this convenient location has to offer. Corporate guests know that this hotel's accommodations in Louisville, KY offer a winning combination: proximity to major area corporations and terrific business amenities. The location ensures easy travel to Papa Johns Corporate Headquarters, YUM! Brands, Ford Motor Company, and GE, but without the price tag of a downtown hotel. The Business Center provides fax and copy services, and the boardroom is a great resource for those planning meetings in Louisville, KY. The hotel's leisure guests can take advantage of an array of local attractions. Families love playing mini-golf and laser tag at Renaissance Fun Park. Churchill Downs, home of the Kentucky Derby, offers a slice of classic Americana. Guests can even explore the history of world-famous Kentucky bourbon with a tour of the Maker's Mark Distillery. Our hotel's suites in Louisville, KY are pet friendly, so treat your four-legged family members to your vacation. You can socialize with other guests at our evening Social Receptions, and you can enjoy a free breakfast daily, too. Start planning your trip to the Derby City today!
